titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Nationalsozialistische deutsche Arbeiter-Partei. Gau Berlin Miscellaneous Records, 1931-1944
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Nationalsozialistische deutsche Arbeiter-Partei. Gau Berlin Miscellaneous Records,
did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, circulars, ordinances, and petitions, relating to Nazi activities in Berlin, the defection of Walter Stennes and others from the Sturmabteilung in 1931, party discipline, and petitions for amnesty.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nationalsozialistische deutsche Arbeiter-Partei. Gau Berlin Miscellaneous Records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

did.unittitle: Files of the office of Der Mobilisations-Beauftragte (Petzold) in the Gauleitung Berlin (1937-1942) containing secret circulars and ordinances
The Stennes case, documentation of the struggle for leadership in the N.S.D.A.P., the defection in the Berlin S.A. (Sturmabteilung) in 1931, and the subsequent purge in the N.S.D.A.P.
Instructions for the party census in 1939, issued by the N.S.D.A.P. Gau Berlin, Gau-Organisationsamt, Hauptstelle Statistik

Miscellaneous files, 1939-1944, of various offices in the Gauleitung Berlin (Geheime Staatspolizei; Gauleitung Wartheland; Organisationsamt Posen; Gaupropagandaleitung Berlin; Die Deutsche Arbeitsfront; etc.) Also reports on the City of Danzig and on the German-Russian campaign in 1941
Three files dealing with disciplinary measures against party members Johannes Pressler, Otto Melcher, Richard Mähler, and Wilhelm Hossfeld, 1934-1941
